lines.text: I'm afraid to go up high. I get heightrophobia.
Come on, stupid. Get the bird!

[looks down]
Ohh...!
Gimme the bird. Gimme the bird!
If that Hays Office would only let me, I'd give him the boid all right.
[whistles]
I tawt I taw a putty tat!
[last lines]
Turn out those lights!
[Catstello is hanging from a wire by one foot; Tweety is jumping on his toes]
Hey, cut it out! Cut it out, pigeon! Don't do that!

[pulls off one toe]
This widdle piddy went to market...
Babbit!

[pulls off second toe]
This widdle piddy tayed home...
Babbit!

[pulls off last toe]
This widdle piddy had woast beef...
Babbit!
[falls]
Well, whatdya know, I wan out of piddies.
But I don't want to hurt no boid. I like boids. I'd go hungry first.
What's the matter, fraidy cat? This is just a tiny bird.
You mean it's just a poor little, teeny-tiny, itsy-bitsy, defenseless bird?
That's right.
Let me at 'im! Let me at 'im! I'll get him, Babbit! Gangway, I'll murdarlize him! Let me at 'im!
[Catstello is sitting on a powder charge which Babbit is ready to detonate]
Gee, Babbit. I'm just no good.
Oh, the brakes were against you.
I'm a flopparoo. I can't even get the boid.
Don't worry. You'll get it, all right.
You mean I'll get it in the end?
Yeah. And you'll get a big bang out of it, too!
[He detonates the charge, sending Catstello flying]

[unaware he is airborne]
Well, that sure takes a load off my mind.
Hewwo? Fourth Interceptive Command? I tee an unidentified fwying object fwying awound my widdle head.
Aw, da poor puddytat. He cah-wushed his widdle head.
Why do you do these things?
I'm a baaaad pussycat.

[sees a flat Catstello]
Come on. Stop your clowning! What's the matter with you? Aren't you ashamed?
I don't know.
